select1.label: Determine if client is unconscious by shaking client and shouting " are you ok"
Activate emergency medical services and call for help
Place the client supine on hard surface or use backboard
Kneel at level of victims shoulder
Open the airway Use a head tilt/ chin maneuver Use modified jaw thrust if a neck injury is suspected Keeping the airway open, look, listen, and feel for normal breathing (not more than 10 secs)
Check the carotid pulse (not more than 10 secs)

If not breathing, Give 30 chest compression as follows: -Kneel by the side of the victim. -Place the heel of one hand in the centre of the victim's chest (which is the lower half of the victim's sternum (breastbone)). -Place the heel of your other hand on top of the first hand. -Interlock the fingers of your hands and ensure that pressure is not applied over the victim's ribs. Do not apply any pressure over the upper abdomen or the bottom end of the sternum. -Position yourself vertically above the victim's chest and, with your arms straight, press down on the sternum 5 - 6 cm. -After each compression, release all the pressure on the chest without losing contact between your hands and the sternum. -Repeat at a rate of 100 - 120 min-1. -Compression and release should take an equal amount of time.

Prepare for artificial respiration
For mouth to mouth resuscitation
Adult : pinch victim's nose and occlude mouth with rescuer's mouth Infant : place mouth over infant's mouth
For mouth to nose resuscitation
Keep victim head tilted with one hand on forehead .use other hand to lift jaw and close mouth. Seal nurses lips around victim's nose and blow. Allow passive exhalation

Administer artificial respiration
For mouth to mouth resuscitation
Adult Blow 2 quick breaths into mouth , adequate time for 2 breaths (1-1.5 seconds per breath ) should be allowed to provide good chest expansion and decreased distention
Infant and child
Administer two slow breaths (1-1.5 seconds per breath ) With pause between rescuer to take breath
artificial respiration with ambu bag Adult : Compress bag fully for two breaths Child : use two small compression of bag
Give 5 cycles of compression and ventilation at the ratio of 30:2. Continue until victim responds or AED arrives.
